content: @WG-rustc-dev-guide can someone prepare the checkin for next week? we've this document https://hackmd.io/Umz8k0PwRb-YVUUEK8i0aQ and there's a script that we run to build the check-in
so, should I run the script and update that hackmd by next week?

1. Grab the date of our last check-in, see our check-ins doc
    -> in this case 2021-09-02

  2. In rustc-dev-guide repo, run ./ci/check-in.sh 2021-09-02
    -> help: you can find the number of PRs merged at https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Amerged+updated%3A%3E2021-09-02

  3. Visit https://github.com/rust-lang/rustc-dev-guide/pulls?q=is%3Apr+is%3Amerged+updated%3A%3E2021-09-02
    -> see that as of today we have 16 PRs

  4. In rustc-dev-guide repo, run ./ci/check-in.sh 2021-09-02 16
    -> You will get the full set of merged PRs and WIP PRs

  5. Paste that to our check-ins doc with the appropriate new check-in date

  6. Remove non relevant stuff
I guess check-in.sh could be made more automatic, having it figuring out the number of PRs and getting rid of those steps would be better :P
@Santiago Pastorino Seems I'm not an owner of the hackmd and cannot edit it, could you give me the perm? My account is https://hackmd.io/@fraternite

Yuki Okushi said:

Santiago Pastorino Seems I'm not an owner of the hackmd and cannot edit it, could you give me the perm? My account is https://hackmd.io/@fraternite

@Yuki Okushi :wave:, how are you doing?
@Yuki Okushi done, I've added you as a member of the HackMD's compiler team, you should be able to edit it now
Confrimed it, thanks for the quick response!
